abstract.p: This proposal provides a PDF module for XPath 2.0. It defines extension functions for converting from one digital format to another, to execute various processing operations of digital documents, etc. It has been designed to be compatible with XQuery 1.0 and XSLT 2.0, as well as any other standard based on XPath 2.0.

status.p: Must be ignored, but is required by the schema...

div1.head: Introduction
div1.p: This PDF module allows manipulation of PDF documents.

div2.head: Namespace conventions
div2.p: The module defined by this document defines functions and elements in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/pdf. In this document, the pdf prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.
Error codes are defined in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/error. In this document, err prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.

div2.head: Error management
div2.p: Error conditions are identified by a code (a QName). When such an error condition is reached during the execution of the function, a dynamic error is thrown, with the corresponding error code (as if the standard XPath function error had been called).

div1.head: Functions for Documents in PDF Format
div1.p: These functions are designated for processing the documents in PDF format.

div2.head: The digi-pub:pdf-merge() Function
div2.p: This function is used for merging two or more (a collection of) PDF documents.

div2.head: The digi-pub:pdf-split() Function
div2.p: This function is used for splitting a PDF document into a number of other PDF documents.
div2.eg: digi-pub:pdf-split($document as xs:base64Binary, $options as element(digi-pub:options)) as xs:base64Binary+

item.p: $document is the PDF document to be splitted.
$options are the options for the current operation.
the digi-pub:split-delimiter child element specifies the delimiter used for splitting the input PDF document.

div2.head: The digi-pub:pdf-to-image() Function
div2.p: This function is used for converting a PDF document to images.

div2.head: The digi-pub:pdf-stamp() Function
div2.p: This function is used for adding a stamp to a PDF document.

div2.head: The digi-pub:pdf-sign() Function
div2.p: This function is used for digitally sign a PDF document.

div2.head: The digi-pub:pdf-encrypt() Function
div2.p: This function is used for encrypting a PDF document by using a digital certificate.

div2.head: The digi-pub:pdf-decrypt() Function
div2.p: This function is used for decrypting a PDF document.

div2.head: The digi-pub:pdf-import-page() Function
div2.p: This function is used for importing to a PDF document a page or more pages from a PDF document.

div2.head: The digi-pub:pdf-export-page() Function
div2.p: This function is used for removing a page or more pages from a PDF document.

div2.head: The digi-pub:pdf-delete-page() Function
div2.p: This function is used for deleting a page or more pages from a PDF document.

div2.head: The digi-pub:add-bookmark() Function
div2.p: This function is used to add bookmarks to a PDF document.
